alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along the Darlington and Chesterfield County line, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Hartsville, Mccoll, Clio, North Hartsville, Dovesville, Mont Clare, Brownsville, Auburn, Clyde, Mechanicsville, Floyd, Dunbar, Kellytown, Society Hill, Blenheim, Tatum and Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
